task.shortdesc: System administrators can configure client certificates by using the Security Settings page in the .

taskbody.prereq: You must create the security profile that you want to associate the client certificates with before you can import the client certificates. For more information about creating security profiles, see .

context.p: You can configure client certificates by using the , or by using . For more information about using to configure client certificates, see .

step.cmd: Go to the Security Settings page in one of the following ways:

choices.choice: From the Home tab, click Server Security in the Secure your environment pane.
From the Server menu, click Security Settings.

step.cmd: From the Security Profiles pane, select a security profile.

choices.choice: To work with trusted CA certificates, select Trusted Certificates.
To work with trusted client certificates, select Client Certificates.

To upload a certificate to the truststore:
Click Browse and navigate to the certificate file.
Click Upload. You can upload a maximum of 100 trusted client certificates for every security profile.

To delete a certificate:
Select the certificate file name in the Certificates grid.
Click the Delete icon.

taskbody.postreq: Ensure that the security profile is applied to an endpoint. For more information about applying a security profile to an endpoint, see .
